body_html:
This is definitely a lot better, especially when it comes to locking the validity check — thanks for this!
I did first a quick review of the code which looked fine 👍 but when running it locally on an invalid form, clicking "Check validity" doesn't show me any error message and shows the success notice "Your application draft was saved."
In itself, this isn't a huuuuge problem since we had some duplicate messages anyway but a) I want to find out why the error messages are not being shown anymore and b) because of how the required fields for the student, which are attached to the student model, are set up (see in student.rb), field validations are not shown in the "About You" tab the same way they are in the other ones. This is sort of a bummer, and I am not sure how to fix it. 😕

body:
This is definitely a lot better, especially when it comes to locking the validity check — thanks for this! 
I did first a quick review of the code which looked fine :+1: but when running it locally on an invalid form, clicking "Check validity" doesn't show me any error message and shows the success notice "Your application draft was saved." 
In itself, this isn't a huuuuge problem since we had some duplicate messages anyway but a) I want to find out why the error messages are not being shown anymore and b) because of how the required fields for the student, which are attached to the student model, are set up (see in `student.rb`), field validations are not shown in the "About You" tab the same way they are in the other ones. This is sort of a bummer, and I am not sure how to fix it. 😕
